summary:
Rwanda-backed rebels defeated Congolese troops and entered Goma in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, prompting gunfire and shelling. Over one million displaced residents are trapped in the city, affecting U.N. aid operations that serve as a humanitarian hub. The incursion threatens regional stability as fighting escalates in the area.

In Pakistan, a suicide bomber detonated at a Shiite mosque in Islamabad during Friday prayers, killing at least 30 worshippers and wounding over 130. Police are investigating the attack, which heightens risks of sectarian violence amid regional instability. Separately, U.S. and Iranian diplomats began talks in Oman on Iran's nuclear program, amid a U.S. military buildup. Progress may occur on nuclear limits, though Iranian officials express doubts over U.S. demands on other issues. An unidentified assailant shot Russian Lt. Gen. Vladimir Alekseyev, deputy chief of military intelligence, multiple times in Moscow; he was hospitalized in an incident echoing prior attacks on military figures during the Ukraine conflict.

NATO launched a coordinated response after another Baltic Sea cable severance, amid a suspected sabotage campaign targeting infrastructure; Baltic allies increased defenses against hybrid threats attributed by some to Russia. Nigerian troops deployed to villages Woro and Nuku in Kwara state following jihadist attacks that killed 162 residents. Israel permitted hundreds of thousands of displaced Palestinians to cross into northern Gaza after a hostage release ended a military zone restriction, though Israeli forces killed two Palestinians in strikes in northern Gaza and Khan Younis amid limited Rafah crossings. NASA and SpaceX launched the Crew-10 mission from Florida on a Falcon 9, carrying four astronauts to the ISS to enable the return of two NASA crew members stuck for nine months. The EU Commission found TikTok's infinite scroll and notifications addictive, violating the Digital Services Act and risking a fine up to 6% of ByteDance's global revenue. A U.S. appeals court in the Fourth Circuit lifted an injunction on Trump administration executive orders halting federal DEI programs. A Nigerian court ordered Britain to pay 420 million pounds to families of 21 coal miners killed by colonial authorities.

headlines.title: Suicide Bomber Kills 30 Worshippers at Shiite Mosque in Islamabad
headlines.summary: Suicide bomber detonates at Shiite mosque in Islamabad during Friday prayers, killing at least 30 and wounding over 130. Worshippers and responders affected in Pakistan's capital. Police investigate; attack escalates sectarian violence risks amid regional instability.

headlines.title: Unidentified Assailant Shoots Russian Lt. Gen. Vladimir Alekseyev in Moscow
headlines.summary: Deputy chief of Russian military intelligence shot multiple times in Moscow and hospitalized. Officer and investigators affected. Incident echoes prior attacks on Russian military figures, signaling internal security threats amid Ukraine conflict.

headlines.title: U.S. and Iran Officials Begin Talks on Nuclear Program in Oman
headlines.summary: U.S. and Iranian diplomats meet in Oman to discuss nuclear program amid U.S. military buildup. Regional actors and global non-proliferation efforts affected. Progress possible on nukes but doubts over other demands heighten Middle East tensions.

headlines.title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Overrun Goma Trapping One Million Displaced in Congo
headlines.summary: Rebels defeat Congolese troops and enter Goma, prompting gunfire and shelling. Over one million displaced residents and U.N. aid operations affected. Escalation threatens humanitarian hub and regional stability in eastern Congo.

headlines.title: NASA and SpaceX Launch Crew-10 from Florida to Retrieve Stuck ISS Astronauts
headlines.summary: SpaceX Falcon 9 carries four astronauts to ISS for six-month rotation, enabling return of two stuck NASA crew after nine months. Astronauts and space program affected. Mission restores routine operations for international station.

headlines.title: Israel Permits Displaced Palestinians to Cross into Northern Gaza
headlines.summary: Israel allows Gazans to return north after hostage release breakthrough ends military zone deadlock. Hundreds of thousands of displaced affected. Move eases humanitarian crisis but ongoing risks persist post-ceasefire.

headlines.title: EU Commission Finds TikTok Addictive Design Violates Digital Services Act
headlines.summary: Preliminary probe cites infinite scroll and notifications as addictive, risking 6% global revenue fine for ByteDance. EU users and platform affected. Forces design changes to protect minors and curb harmful features.

headlines.title: U.S. Appeals Court Lifts Injunction on Trump Administration DEI Crackdown
headlines.summary: Fourth Circuit panel rules executive orders halting federal DEI programs likely constitutional. Government agencies and employees affected. Enables enforcement nationwide, reshaping workplace diversity policies.

headlines.title: Nigerian Court Orders Britain to Pay 420 Million Pounds for 21 Colonial-Era Coal Miner Deaths
headlines.summary: Court mandates UK payment to families of miners killed by colonial administration, faulting Nigeria's government for inaction. Victims' relatives affected. Ruling revives reparations push for colonial injustices.

headlines.title: NATO Launches Coordinated Response After Another Baltic Sea Cable Severance
headlines.previousContext: Alliance activates first joint operation following new suspected sabotage incident
headlines.summary: NATO responds to severed deep-sea cable amid sabotage campaign targeting critical infrastructure. Baltic allies and energy security affected. Heightens defenses against hybrid threats from Russia.

headlines.title: Nigerian Troops Deploy to Western Villages After Jihadists Kill 162 Residents
headlines.previousContext: Village chief recounts killing of two sons and kidnapping of wife as military arrives
headlines.summary: Government sends troops to Woro and Nuku following massacre. 162 killed, families like chief's affected. Deployment aims to curb jihadist violence spreading in Kwara state.

headlines.title: Israeli Forces Kill Two Palestinians in Northern Gaza Amid Rafah Trickle
headlines.previousContext: Post-ceasefire returns begin north while strikes continue and Rafah crossing sees minimal movement
headlines.summary: Strikes target northern Gaza and Khan Younis, killing two as some cross Rafah. Palestinians affected. Underscores fragile truce and restricted mobility in enclave.
